intro: Hedysarum coeruleoviolaceum, commonly known as the blue-violet peavine, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a perennial legume characterized by its slender, climbing stems and trifoliate leaves. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers that range in color from blue to violet, which are typically borne in clusters. Hedysarum coeruleoviolaceum has small, stipitate pods that contain several elliptical seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or rocky habitats.
